strings.Value: "What have we learned of our attackers?"
"How bad are casualties among the guards and the civilians?"
"A fine day today, isn't it? Last time we had a party like this was our fight with the Stag Lord!"
[Leave] "Stay vigilant â€” the fight is far from over."
{n}The captain removes his helmet and wipes the sweat from his brow.{/n} "Praise all the good gods. I'm not sure we could have held out much longer without you."
"Yes, Your Gra-" {n}A thunderous rumble sounds from not far off. Something humongous is approaching, crushing buildings along its path.{/n}
"Substantial, Your Grace. If you'd arrived much later, I've no doubt the capital would have been lost."

"Very little. Some of the monsters erupted from the patients in Kavken's hospital, while others seem to have come straight out of the woods. There are no people among them, and they don't seem to have a commander. They fight more like raging beasts than an army. That's all we know right now."
{n}The captain salutes you.{/n} "Thank you, Your Grace!"
{n}A grin crosses the fighter's solemn face.{/n} "Quite the party indeed. A shame there's no music."
"Yes, I saw him fighting his way toward the town center not long ago."
